author: drelicnft
title: dRelic
description: Traditional bidding methods are uninteresting and do not take advantage of the power the blockchain offers.

assessments.note: I like the idea. The scope is manageable and the described solution will be a nice application which uses blockchain in a meaningful way.

First of all, I love many approaches that think outside the box and the proposer here clearly has a novel approach and enthusiasm for proposing a new model to approaching and using NFTs. The campaign brief for ths challenge states "Novel and viable applications get built of top of Cardano attracting users". I would agree that he is proposing a novel application, however I am not completely convinced in its viability based on the presented information. More detailed information would be required from the proposer to ensure that the viability of his idea is clearer. As its stands now, it mostly seems like an idea that has been pitched - whether it is viable is unclear without a presented plan and more details.

Ok, so you wish to create a website for selling art NFTs, right? And you need money for that. I would like to know what kind of art: where does it come from, how many artists, how do you bring users to the platform? More details please.

I like the concept of looking at bidding wars in another way/light. However, I would have liked to learn more how the solution would present benefit to the cardano community at large. There isn't a specific link made presently that would make it very obvious. There also is an issue with the fact that this proposal reads more like an idea than a proposal in full length.
Many things seem to be already finished. The description of the solution is well thought and the available team covers the most important aspects.

One of the weaknesses of this proposal is that the experience and plan presented are not sufficiently convincing as they are "bare bones" . If the team does have the ability to source from the talent and resources such as Developers & Programmers, Project Manager, Large pool of artists and Marketing & Brand Design - it would be best to include more information about that. Also, a budgetary plan and a timetable with deliverables for the plan would help this proposal make much more headway and it would sound more convincing.
You seem to be quite passionate about what you do and very much loyal to the Cardano community. Any chance this could be scaled up in the upcoming funds to be something more?

It isn't entirely clear how the budget is going to be allocated beyond knowing one grand figure. There also is an issue with how the relevant experience is presented. We are unable to verify the claims as there are no links that would let us know who proposers are and what their backgrounds are. Simple linked in page or professional work from past be very useful. There is a reference to stake pool operation - when looking up on adapools and following webpage - it doesn't answer questions on identity as there is just no information that would help on that front. I also lack sensible plan that would help tie it all together beyond conceptual stage that this seems to be in now.
Many things seem to be already finished. The description of the solution is well thought and the available team covers the most important aspects.

I think that this proposal does not provide sufficient information to assess how feasible it is and how effectively it addresses the challenge. It would benefit from a very thorough think-through and the development of a clear plan of action. I am not assessing the idea itself here (alone) - the idea seems solid enough, what is missing is supporting information and planning.
Please provide a more detailed plan and road map. Show metrics and goals.

Proposal makes some effort to show what is needed but a form of better roadmap/milestones he more useful. It would help us understand how this proposal intends to make things successful. There also isn't any sentiment with regards to challenges/risks associated with proposal and how authors are planning to approach these. Neither how the success is going to be measured. Knowing some targets, KPIs or similar metrics - would help community understand how to benchmark progress more effectively in the end.

solution: Through gamifying a curated drop of selected artists, utilizing pre-determined rules that are executed automatically via smart contracts.
